query: When you take the average of the standard population deviation of the red numbers and the standard sample deviation of the green numbers in this image using the statistics module in Python 3.11, what is the result rounded to the nearest three decimal points?

tasks.description: Обработать изображение, чтобы извлечь красные и зеленые числа.

processed.name: df6561b2-7ee5-4540-baab-5095f742716a.png

tasks.description: Извлечь стандартное отклонение для красных чисел и стандартное отклонение для зеленых чисел.

entities.name: red_numbers_std_dev
entities.evidence: Standard deviation calculated from red numbers: [24, 39, 54, 29, 73, 33]

entities.name: green_numbers_std_dev

key_points: Standard deviation for red numbers is calculated from the values: 24, 39, 54, 29, 73, 33.
Standard deviation for green numbers is calculated from the values: 74, 28, 28.

tasks.description: Вычислить среднее значение стандартного отклонения красных и зеленых чисел.

result.python_code:
import statistics

# Red and green numbers
red_numbers = [24, 39, 54, 29, 73, 33]
green_numbers = [74, 28, 28]

# Calculate standard deviations
std_dev_red = statistics.stdev(red_numbers)
std_dev_green = statistics.stdev(green_numbers)

# Calculate average of standard deviations
average_std_dev = (std_dev_red + std_dev_green) / 2

# Print results
print(f'Standard Deviation of Red Numbers: {std_dev_red}')
print(f'Standard Deviation of Green Numbers: {std_dev_green}')
print(f'Average of Standard Deviations: {average_std_dev}')
result.output:
Standard Deviation of Red Numbers: 18.373894524569362
Standard Deviation of Green Numbers: 26.558112382722786
Average of Standard Deviations: 22.466003453646074
